author: Roger Villeda
text: "Randomly selected this restaurant on our way home after visiting Manhattan. Great surprise! Food was delicious
column5: lady was very nice and food came out pretty quick too. It's small inside but outside seating was available. Ordered the Croque Foresti√®re
column6: pomme frites and an Arnold Palmer. Definitely would visit again"

author: Shawn Varughese
text: "I came here with a group of four on a Saturday morning for brunch. The ambience and the conversation was excellent but the food wasn't as tasty as we expected. We ordered three items
column5: brioche french toast
column6: fruity crepe
column7: and the ham omelette. The brioche french toast was not soft and seemed dried out. The crepe was larger than we expected but the texture was very thin and fell apart which made it difficult to eat. Finally
column8: the omelette was my favorite item on the menu and came with a large portion size. However nothing stood out in terms of flavor. While the location and ambience were great
column9: we were disappointed overall with the food quality given the cost."

author: Tsz Kuk Daisy Leung
text: "Highly recommend coming here if you are looking for one of a kind dining experience. It will help you appreciate life and people around more.\n\nWe came here on Saturday around 1pm for brunch. There were plenty of outdoor seating. We asked to be seated and was seated not according to the order at which customers arrive. The owner sat another party who arrived after us before attending to us. While he had offered us to choose between indoor and outdoor seating
column5: we opted for outdoor
column6: given that we have a dog with us. I had asked if we could sit by the desk closest to the store to avoid the dog from getting distracted by pedestrians and to be able to settle. He declined in a rather rude manner.\n\nAs we were seated
column7: he came to take ours orders and demonstrated that he was rather impatient with his customers.\n\nWhile we had asked for water
column8: we weren't given any. Instead the owner just stood by the store front.\n\nThere was a flowerless plant next to our table
column9: which had a disgusting chicken wing bone inside. Our dog sniffed the plant and found the gross bone inside the plant
column10: causing her to keep sniffing there. According to the owner
column11: this is a plant he had water daily for a year. I was surprised that he had no idea what kind of rotten bone was hidden there. To prevent my dog from swallowing it
column12: I grabbed the bone and tossed it. I went to restroom to wash and sanitizer my fingers. The moment I came back out
column13: he came to us and complained to us about our dog eating the flowers from his precious flowerless plant that he had babied for a year. At this point
column14: we decided we have enough opportunity to appreciate how lucky we have been in life to be surrounded by kind folks
column15: we left. I am sorry for the bitter owner
column16: whatever may have happened in his life.\n\nWhile the owner has an attitude towards dogs and their owners
column17: all his customers are friendly. They love our dog
column18: and so does the owner next door
column19: who offered water for our dog and to pet her.\n\nIf you are too sick of nice people
column20: or need to be reminded how lucky you have been in life
column21: this is the place for you. I am rooting for this place!\n\nIf google map offers negative stars
column22: this place will receive a -5 stars. It's the best of the worst!"

author: Yuanyuan Xiao
text: 'We had the most horrible restaurant experience here. The owner clearly has attitude issue. He is exceptional rude and we ended up having to leave before our food is here. Avoid this place. Seriously.'

author: sanyam
text: 'Excellent Belgium waffles and egg Benedict

author: B L
text: 'Bad food and terrible coffee. Definitely not coming back‚Ä¶'

author: nalin ahuja
text: 'Bad tasting food. No flavors
column5: very bland. We ordered an avacado toast and a Greek omelette. Avacado toast had absolutely no flavors
column6: not even salt. We had to ask for it separately. Same thing for the omelette. It was just fluffy and even with hot sauce
column7: I was finding it hard to eat. We did not finish the food as the restaurant is claiming that we did.'

author: C O
text: 'If you are willing to have a good experience
column5: this is not the best place. I went there for a breakfast on my own. And was clear that the manager (the guy who managers table) don‚Äôt see the customers as customers and just like money
column6: was clearly the difference how he treated me different just because I was alone and automatically I was going to spent less then the other people. He asked nice to take one of the chairs from the table I was and but then he told me he needed more chairs and more tables (that was a indirect way to tell to leave). The food super was cold
column7: nobody brought me water. And at the end I asked for a box for my leftover sandwich and a to go cup for my coffee that he didn‚Äôt listen to
column8: so when he came back just with the box for the sandwich I was for the cup again and he impolitely rolled his eyes to me like I was annoying him.\nSo obviously I am not going back.'

text: "We went for lunch and ordered veggie sandwich and smoked salmon sandwich. The veggie sandwich was too bland (almost no salt) and salmon sandwich was way too salty. Also
column5: the way they bill is very weird as they do not give you a breakdown. I felt I was charged more and reading the comments I think they did charge 4$ for 2 of us as cover fee or reservation fee or whatever fancy name you wanna give. It seemed sort of a cheating in a way. They should be upfront about these charges not try to hide it by not giving a breakdown of the bill.\n\nTo Owner: Thank you so much for such a humble reply
column6: probably next time you can also comment on food. I wouldn't have bother about $4 extra had I not paid for 2nd lunch from somewhere else."

text: 'I ordered a pure vegetarian mushroom crepe
column5:
my waiter forgot to inform in the kitchen and served me ham in my crepe.

To your response....
All my friends were together and had the same expirience so you can imagine and expect similar review from us all.

text: "I ordered takeout from here for a Mother's Day social distancing brunch. They exceeded my expectations! I placed my order the day before and the next morning they had my large order ready to go with all the bags packed and labeled. They even included a DELICIOUS free brownie on the house! All of the food was exceptional. We ordered some omelettes
column5: the croque madame
column6: the quiche
column7: the goat cheese salad and the nutella crepe. All delectable! Top notch service and quality all around. I'm looking forward to returning once this lockdown is over as their space is so cute!"

author: Lisa Marie Zapata
text: "La Bouche is a lovely euro style eatery. The attention you receive is warm and welcoming. I had the French burger and it was delicious. All the ingredients were fresh and of high quality. There's a calmness to La Bouche that I wouldn't trade for the trendiest place. I'll return."

author: jeromesakuro
text: 'Great food and service.'

author: Roos Aciksoz
text: 'The food was good but the attitude of the staff should be reviewed. I really liked the interior design and wanted to make this my favorite spot but some issues must be discussed. At the end I decided not to come back again. They made me feel very rushed and uncomfortabel while the entire place was almost empty. First I took coffee
column5: in less then 15 minutes she asked me three times whether I want something else. I explained that I am fine with the cappucino for now but that I will order more after a while. She kept coming and giving me looks. I thought that she might not like it that I sit there with my laptop. I told her politely that she may feel free to move me to a single table if she needs the table for larger groups. In the meantime there were still empty large tables. She answered: yeah ok and again gave me some look. I felt so uncomfortable that I ordered  lunch quite early. I asked the cheque and her communication around that was also zero. As a costomer I had way more polite and friendly behaviour towards her than she towards me. After paying I thanked and said goodbye: she did not look or answer back. So
column6: good food but definitely not worth to tolerate the attitude.'

author: Deanna Bova
text: 'Went to La Bouche Caf√© to support their new location. Ended up paying $29 for a salad and tea. Owner charged me an additional $14 for a plate I accidentally ordered based on a misleading description. I did not eat/touch it but I had to pay for it because "it left the kitchen." I could not eat the plate due to a gluten allergy. Those with food allergies beware.'

author: Jane Liang
text: "Amazing addition to the downtown area. Also passed it in the morning on the way to work so I finally decided to stop by. Came before 8 in the morning (didn't realize they just opened!). However
column5: the owner was very generous to let me place an order while I was there and return to pay. Can't beat good service and good accommodations.\n\nTried their cheese omelette and their Greek omelette. Omelettes came with a side order of potatoes and lettuce. Loved that it came in compostable boxes! Their iced coffee was also good - added a bit of caramel syrup for flavor. Can't wait to return and try some more of their items"

text: 'Unfortunately won‚Äôt be coming back. It looks cute and the waitress was working super hard but it‚Äôs like everything was working against her.  Everything took so long and seemed chaotic. Finally

author: Myrna Hilton Woods
text: "I was extremely happy with this place in the beginning but my latest order had me very disappointed. The tomato soup and half smoked salmon sandwich special was my go to for lunch. It started off great
column5: but the quality declined after.  I had decided not to go back because the bread was cold from my last order (like it was just taken out of the refrigerator) and not toasted or heated which took away from the sandwich
column6: but I decided to give it one more try. This time my meal was incomplete without the usual side of greens which is a huge no no for me. I felt like I was getting less than what I paid for. It may seem like something simple to some but you never know what aspect of a meal gratifies a customer. I did return the incomplete meal to which she threw a couple of leaves in there. I had referred this place to a couple of friends for a light and healthy lunch but sadly I will not be returning or referring. If the owner is the person who prepared my sandwich I'm pretty sure she will know who I am after reading this."

author: Kyle Moreno
text: 'Nutella crepe was üî•! Fast service and the outdoor and indoor decore is cozy! Will come back!!'

author: Jamie Shea
text: 'My new favorite in Hoboken. Quaint and the food is great. Not a ton of seating so could be a small wait. Coffee is superb.\nI love how they present the check in a little box.'

author: shan gao
text: 'The worst crepe I have ever had. The crepe is burnt!!!!'

author: Gina Merlo
text: 'Fabulous breakfast
column5: fresh
column6: tasty
column7: yum!  Excellent service also!'

author: Chris McLaughlin
text: 'Nice outdoor seating and good location. Food is mediocre and service could be improved.'

author: amina parveen
text: 'Absolutely loved it! Great ambiance and place for brunch!'

author: Malavika Muralidharan
text: "Very cute little cafe. Cosy seats and nice decor! I bought the lunch special (small soup and sandwich) which was delicious. Croutons and cheese on the soup were good. Will definitely return to try other things on the menu. Took one star off because the soup was luke warm and there was no spoon in the utensils pack (which I would think is important when someone's buying soup!)."

author: Rebecca Mozdy
text: 'Seemed like a nice place. But then the waitress told us she wouldn‚Äôt bring us water because we had laptops on the table. And then she asked us to move for new customers even though we had ordered drinks five minutes earlier. I‚Äôve never had that happen before. We finished our drinks as quickly as we could and I doubt we‚Äôll ever come back.'

author: Bronwyn Held
text: "Tiny cafe so you'll have to wait but it's worth it. The food is amazing. They have classics like omelettes and crepes but also odd stuff like salted caramel with bacon and cheese which was really good. Excellent drinks too. Really cozy place that deserves a visit"

author: Pavel Yakushevich
text: 'A nice little quiet cafe couple of blocks away from Washington street. The French theme is cute
column5: and they actually make good espresso. Will definitely return.'

author: T. S. Collins
text: 'Ordered the Croque Madam to go and it was very good.'

author: Kinjal Gala
text: 'A cute small place perfect for a Saturday brunch with amazing waffles'

author: Christina Montgomery
text: 'I really want to love this place
column5: and have tried it many times
column6: but the food always falls short for me. All of the items on the menu look so great but when I get the food it is always pretty bland. Most recently I had the avocado toast with a poached egg and ‚Äújalape√±o salsa‚Äù and was very disappointed.. the jalape√±o salsa had no spice and MUST have come from a jar.. tasted exactly like Tostitos! It drenched my food and made the bread very soggy.\nOn a positive note the inside decor is adorable and the cappuccinos are yummy...'

author: leynie rodriguez
text: 'This place is a hidden gem in Hoboken. Absolutely wonderful!'

author: Ilya Margoulis
text: 'Chocolate on soy milk tasted like hot water with lots of sugar...'

author: Adam Roughley
text: 'Excellent service and food.'

author: Jacob Ben
text: 'Excellent brunch spot.  The owners are fantastic. Great for a date or to take someone you love out for a quick bite.'

author: William Hough
text: 'Great local place.  Best breakfast in area.'

author: Alessandro Zanon
text: 'Nice place for breakfast and brunch. Good cakes and coffees'

author: Neil Sinha
text: 'Great breakfast place'

author: Brittany Deeney
text: 'Came in
column5: everything was good/ good vibes. The waitress pointed us toward a table & we sat. The waitress Came out with our food & my order was not correct.  She asked me if I was fine with just keeping the meal how I had it. I decided to tell them to remake it (something I never do). The seem to be owner manager/ than came up to us and asked us to sit at another table/ while my other friends had their entrees in front of them. Completely shocked by this request/ we decided to just sit where we were. We also had ice coffee from a different restaurant and left mine on the table. The manager ran outside and asked me to take it. & than prodceeed to walk outside and throw the ice coffee at a public trash can. Honestly just bazarre and confused why the manager was acting this way to paying customers. I would not go back.'

author: Mitchell McKinnon
text: 'Beautiful cafe in Hoboken - I really enjoyed it!'

author: mark portrick
text: 'Service needs to step up.  Otherwise the food is ok'

author: Erin Fitzpatrick
text: "I was really excited to try this place
column5: especially after a recent trip to France. The food was excellent but I was really disappointed with the level of service we received. It was almost like they kept forgetting we were there. I noticed everyone else got a pitcher of water immediately when they were seated
column6: and it wasn't until I asked someone after about 20 minutes if we could get water that we got ours. Also
column7: it took about 25 minutes for our coffee orders to come - we were still waiting for them as people who sat down after us were getting their meals. Then
column8: my husband got his meal and I told him to go ahead and start eating
column10: and he was finished eating before mine came about 10 minutes later.\n\nI would like to give them another chance because it seemed like everyone else was getting perfectly fine service
column11: I was just very disappointed this time."

author: Gavin u…ê∆É·¥öo…Ø
text: 'Beautiful and delicious.'

author: Nicole Jala
text: "Great local neighborhood cafe!  Omelettes
column5: egg sandwiches
column6: panini and salads
column7: plus baked goods and hot/iced drinks.  Service can sometimes be a little slow if they're busy but always friendly service and tasty dishes.  Definitely a unique local spot."

author: Peter Praum
text: "It's a cozy vintage style cafe in the heart of Hoboken. A place to be
column5: a place to get out of the rush.\nI had the Chicken Panini and my wife the Smoked salmon sandwich- excellent!!\nKids welcome!!!!"

author: Andrew Stranovsky
text: 'Outdoor seating
column5: quick service
column6: and plenty of choices for brunch.  Ordered the salmon crepe thinking it would be small and light
column7: but it was huge and more than enough.'

author: Swapnil A
text: 'Nice cozy & quiet breakfast/brunch place. Avocado egg toast was really good
column5: especially the salsa.Crepes could have been better.'

author: Thomas Rausch
text: 'Great place for breakfast and coffee'

author: Samar
text: 'Great place
column5: yummy food
column6: great music
column7: and excellent service!'

author: humer101
text: 'A lot of options on this restaurant'

author: John Harrison
text: 'Excellent scratch made food in a quaint environment. Seems family owned and authentic. Will visit again.'

author: Ali Avni Cirik
text: 'Nice cozy place'

author: Yash Desai
text: "Their vegan options are limited and when I visited during brunch there were quite a few bugs / flies.  The place doesn't look sanitary to me. Also
column5: they took over 20 mins to get my sandwich ready. I think they missed my queue the first time. Not cool!"

author: Angelo Va
text: 'Breakfast @2pm... Excellent choices!'

author: Martin Kremmer
text: 'Great boutique and relaxing place...great service
column5: great food and coffeeüòä'

author: Briana Grace
text: 'Food is absolutely fantastic!! Everything on that menu never disappoints. Breakfast & lunch.'

author: Marissa Sauer
text: 'This is one of my favorite spots in Hoboken! The deviled egg
column5: Caesar salad
column6: and goaty pain are my go to picks. The service is a bit slow but I never seem to mind. Makes me take my time and slow down a but from my fast paced life.'

author: Jim Mannoia
text: 'Great food/coffee/vibe... Too tight to hang out for long though.'

author: James Chen
text: 'Great little cafe offering quiet and cozy environment. The chef is improving every time we went there!'

author: Chris Bateman
text: 'I LOVE this place. One of my favorite brunches in Hoboken.  They have casual service
column5: lots of great menu options and friendly staff.  The food is amazing and their coffee is strong and delicious.'

author: M G
text:
'The carry out service is great!
And the food is fantastic!
The omelet (ham & cheese) very tasty
The banana & strawberry crepes yummy!
Highly recommended.'
